output_data.clarification_question: Did the patient specify the total duration of the current major depressive episode (i.e., the symptoms that led to the start of Sertraline last month)?
output_data.suggested_answer: The current severe exacerbation, marked by high functional impairment (missing 3 days of work), has lasted 'a rough couple of weeks.' The overall episode is at least 4 weeks, as that is the duration of the current *Sertraline* trial.

presenting_symptoms.context: Wakes up and wants to pull covers over head
presenting_symptoms.impact: Barely able to get out of bed; missed 3 days of work this week
Wakes up at 3 AM and cannot return to sleep
Feels like a failure; feels like she is letting husband and kids down

presenting_symptoms.context: Thinks family would be better off without her
presenting_symptoms.impact: Wishes she could disappear sometimes; denies active suicidal intent or plan

mental_status_exam.behavior: not assessed (Implied low psychomotor activity given fatigue)
mental_status_exam.thought_content: Preoccupied with failure, guilt, and passive death ideation
mental_status_exam.perception: not assessed (No evidence of psychosis reported)
mental_status_exam.insight: Good (Acknowledges symptoms and is willing to pursue treatment changes)
mental_status_exam.judgment: Intact (Maintains safety due to concern for family)

past_psychiatric_history.prior_episodes: Patient denies previous manic/hypomanic episodes and states she has 'always been more on the low side if anything'.

functional_assessment.work_impairment: Significant (Missed 3 days of work this week)
functional_assessment.social_impairment: Implied stress on family due to guilt

assessment_scales.result: Passive suicidal ideation endorsed (wish to disappear), but no intent or plan.
